snippet: Question 2, if approved, would allow the state to expand charter schools. A pitched battle over the measure reflects the passions that the debate has aroused nationwide....
abstract: Massachusetts ballot proposal on whether to expand charter schools fuels contentious campaigning from both sides of debate; experts expect decision by voters in state seen as trendsetter on education policy to have national effects.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and JESS BIDGOOD

lead_paragraph: Question 2, if approved, would allow the state to expand charter schools. A pitched battle over the measure reflects the passions that the debate has aroused nationwide.

headline.main: Trump-Clinton? Charter Schools Are the Big Issue on Massachusetts’ Ballot
headline.print_headline: The Big Race in Massachusetts (No, Not That One): It’s Over Charter Schools
